segment.source: Restrict Server Access to Members of a Group Only (Windows 10)
segment.target: Restrict Server Access to Members of a Group Only (Windows 10)

segment.source: Restrict Server Access to Members of a Group Only
segment.target: Restrict Server Access to Members of a Group Only

segment.source: Restrict Server Access to Members of a Group Only
segment.target: Restrict Server Access to Members of a Group Only

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: After you have configured the IPsec connection security rules that force client devices to authenticate their connections to the isolated server, you must configure the rules that restrict access to only those devices or users who have been identified through the authentication process as members of the isolated server’s access group.
segment.target: After you have configured the IPsec connection security rules that force client devices to authenticate their connections to the isolated server, you must configure the rules that restrict access to only those devices or users who have been identified through the authentication process as members of the isolated server’s access group.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Create a firewall rule to access isolated servers running Windows Server 2008 or later
segment.target: Create a firewall rule to access isolated servers running Windows Server 2008 or later

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.
segment.target: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.

segment.source: To create a firewall rule that grants access to an isolated server
segment.target: To create a firewall rule that grants access to an isolated server

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management Console to Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management Console to Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.

segment.source: You must edit the GPO that applies settings to servers in the isolated server zone.
segment.target: You must edit the GPO that applies settings to servers in the isolated server zone.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, right-click Inbound Rules, and then click New Rule.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, right-click Inbound Rules, and then click New Rule.

segment.source: On the Rule Type page, click Custom, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Rule Type page, click Custom, and then click Next.

segment.source: If you must restrict access to a single network program, then you can select This program path, and specify the program or service to which to grant access.
segment.target: If you must restrict access to a single network program, then you can select This program path, and specify the program or service to which to grant access.

segment.source: Otherwise, click All programs, and then click Next.
segment.target: Otherwise, click All programs, and then click Next.

segment.source: If you must restrict access to only some TCP or UDP port numbers, then enter the port numbers on the Protocol and Ports page.
segment.target: If you must restrict access to only some TCP or UDP port numbers, then enter the port numbers on the Protocol and Ports page.

segment.source: Otherwise, set Protocol type to Any, and then click Next.
segment.target: Otherwise, set Protocol type to Any, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Scope page, select Any IP address for both local and remote addresses, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Scope page, select Any IP address for both local and remote addresses, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Action page, click Allow the connection if it is secure.
segment.target: On the Action page, click Allow the connection if it is secure.

segment.source: If required by your design, you can also click Customize and select Require the connections to be encrypted.
segment.target: If required by your design, you can also click Customize and select Require the connections to be encrypted.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Users and Computers page, select the check box for the type of accounts (computer or user) you want to allow, click Add, and then enter the group account that contains the device and user accounts permitted to access the server.
segment.target: On the Users and Computers page, select the check box for the type of accounts (computer or user) you want to allow, click Add, and then enter the group account that contains the device and user accounts permitted to access the server.
